definition: bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam

sentences.english: B CT scan of the lower abdomen shows beaking and collapsed bowel loops at the retrocecal recess.
sentences.chinese: 下腹部CT掃描顯示盲腸後隱窩處腸管塌陷呈鳥嘴徵。

sentences.english: Place your tea cup under the beak and set it to the desired time.
sentences.chinese: 把你的茶杯放到鳥嘴下面並定好想要的時間。

sentences.english: Now use a small, soft-edged brush to get rid of the object in the bird's mouth.
sentences.chinese: 用一個小一點的軟筆刷清除鳥嘴處的東西。

sentences.english: Kiwi, long-beaked chicken-sized birds that cannot fly, live only in New Zealand.
sentences.chinese: 鷸鴕鳥嘴比鳥的嘴有長很多，不會飛，生活在新西蘭。

sentences.english: It seized its prey using its tentacles and beak-like mouth to rip apart.
sentences.chinese: 它用它觸手和鳥嘴一樣的嘴將捕獲物撕裂。

sentences.english: The meteor that thrusts in with needle bill.
sentences.chinese: 真減半的鳥嘴如流星般擠進來。

definition: "The Ugly Duckling" by Hans Christian Andersen 安徒生[An1 tu2 sheng1]
with dishevelled hair (idiom)/with one's hair down
clever and eloquent (idiom); fluent/having the gift of the gab
When you enter a country, follow the local customs (idiom); do as the natives do/When in Rome, do as the Romans do
reptiles/also written 爬行類|爬行类
